Posts.Content: Jul 30, 2015 01:35PM survivorround2 wrote: I just started on Doxcil Tuesday. Today I feel nauseous. My brain is foggy, but that could be from the Vicodin as well. Or the fact that my mind is still getting used the fact that my cancer returned like 7 months after the initial treatment was over. I have Triple Negative BC. I just found out last Friday that I have mets in liver, bones and lungs. I am hoping to live longer than the 6 month prognosis that was given if I don't do any treatment. I will post more as things develop. And I will be very interested in any advice! :) Sue
Posts.Title: Doxil! steelrose steelrose

Posts.Content: Sep 14, 2015 01:18PM survivorround2 wrote: Thanks to the magic mouthwash and the salt/baking soda rinses, my mouth sores are more tolerable now!! I still can't eat pizza yet. :) I do have the red bumps and they are itchy. I try not to scratch too much, but they are all over my back, arms and getting to my legs. I look horrible!! No shorts for me! :) Anyway, does anyone have any creams or lotions that might help. I am using Lubriderm. I would take a Benadryl, but that would make me sleep. I am tired enough as it is! :) I looked up the milkweed balm, but that seems like it's more for pain. Sue
Posts.Title: Doxil! steelrose steelrose

Posts.Content: Sep 7, 2015 12:29PM survivorround2 wrote: I wish I didn't have any side effects!!! What do you all do about the horrid nausea and throwing up? THAT is what is keeping me feeling crappy. I have lost 15 pounds in 2 months. My mouth hurts, though no sores. My esophagus is swollen from throwing up so much. I feel like I have a huge lump in my throat. Any ideas? Maybe I am not taking my zofran correctly? Sue
Posts.Title: Doxil! steelrose steelrose

Posts.Content: Sep 12, 2015 04:00PM survivorround2 wrote: Rose, As far as I know I am not scheduled for a scan. My onc put me on Doxcil until she got the results back from my tumor testing. Hopefully, that will show something more effective. I am going to talk to her about this. I am really miserable. I am not a whiny, weak person. I can handle a lot. I still have to care for my disabled adult children and run a household, but I just don't know if "living" like this is worth it. I quit work. I am on LTD. Thanks goodness I was smart enough to take out that policy! :) I am a teacher and we don't pay into SS, so no SSDI for me. I will try the salt and baking soda. It can't hurt!! :) I keep seeing the ad for Little Ceasar's Pizza on TV and I want to eat it sooo bad!! I can't though because of the sores. Anything acidic still hurts. Thanks for responding!! :) Sue
Posts.Title: Doxil! steelrose steelrose

Posts.Content: Sep 12, 2015 02:55PM survivorround2 wrote: I will talk with the RN about the nausea. What about the mouth sores? This round (#2) it's horrible. My tummy feels better and I want to eat, but the sores in my mouth are awful. :( I can still only tolerate protein drinks and popsicles. I have lost even more weight! I got a script for "magic mouthwash" but that only numbs some of my mouth (the part that doesn't hurt!) for about 5 minutes. The only thing that seems to ease the pain is 600mg Motrin. I am due for round 3 in 2 weeks and I am thinking about telling the doc to just stop. I don't even know if the Doxcil working. I cannot do this anymore. I will take whatever time I have left and enjoy it! :) I haven't gotten the hand/foot issues, but I am sure that is coming. Thanks for listening to my whining, but I am really at witts end!! Sue
Posts.Title: Doxil! steelrose steelrose
